alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 7:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Ulster, southwestern Albany, western Greene and southeastern Schoharie Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 728 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Roxbury to Hartwood. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ellenville, Hunter, Woodstock, Westerlo, Windham, Prattsville, Kerhonkson, Napanoch, Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Preston-Potter Hollow, Phoenicia, Preston Hollow, Mount Tremper, Lanesville, Olivebridge, Wawarsing, Crawford and Shandaken. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster
